You are configuring Dynamics 365 Sales for a US-based company as follows:
✑ Utah to California is the West territory
✑ Illinois to Colorado is the Central territory.
✑ Maine to Indiana is the East territory.
The company wants the territories set up as follows:
✑ Salespersons 1 and 2 sell in the West territory.
✑ Salespersons 5 and 6 sell in the Central territory.
✑ Salespersons 3 and 4 sell in the East territory.
✑ Postal code for each state used as the location.
You need to set up the territories.
Solution:
✑ Create the West territory, add the manager, and save.
✑ Repeat for the Central and East territories.
✑ Add the members for each territory.
✑ Select Related and add the Resource territories.
Does the solution meet the goal?

discussion.content:
Set up Kanban. 
Advanced Settings > Customize > Customize the System > Select Entities > Select Opportunity > Select Tab Control > Add Control > Navigate to Kanban > Add Kanban control
Answer: In Advanced Settings, select the correct setting

View the opportunities in the sales cycle? Guessing Kanban in Business Process Flow is meant here, and not Kanban in Oppty status, as there are no more Kanban flavours at the moment.
Answer should then be: Change the Kanban type to a Business Process Flow.

Change the status to the same status view? Guessing "change the opportunity status in the Kanban Status view" is meant here.
Answer should then be: Drag the oppty to another column.

"You add the Kanban control to the Opportunity entity." So it is already added. Even if you don't activate the PCF control "Kanban" by clicking the checkmark via system customization, you are able to select "Show as" --> "Kanban" via the command bar. 
--> Set up Kanban = via comand bar is correct
Is correct. "Sales Cycle" to me are the status reason, not BPF stages.

comments.content: A sales cycle is made up of a series of stages that go from the initial contact to the closing of a sale ( Qualify > Devlop > Propose > Close ...... So BPF)
